Using the Chatterbox: Private Messaging

Complete info on private messaging is available in [id://419625].

PerlMonks users can send private messages to each other. Sending a private message is typically done via one of the [id://17989|Chatterbox] clients: simply begin the message text with /msg other_username.

For example, someone could send [vroom] a message by entering:

/msg vroom This site is great!
See [id://535689|/msg] for more info.

Private messages can be sent even if the other user is not logged on. The message will show up in their private [id://419625|message inbox] the next time they log in.

Note: Private messaging is only available to registered PerlMonks users. If you haven't registered yet, [create a new user].

If another user is bothering you, you can block all messages from that user. To do this, enter /ignore other_username. This will block private messages to your inbox from that user. For more info on this, see [id://535690]. To see a list of users you are currently ignoring, go to [id://16082].
